steps.repeatableText: I have more medications to add

steps.title: IBD medication
Thank you for participating in SPARC IBD!
steps.text:
We would like to learn a little bit about you to better understand how your Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) is currently affecting you. Please answer the survey below, which asks questions about your background, current IBD medications, and IBD symptoms.
Thanks again for your participation!

steps.title: Please identify your ethnicity?
Which of the following best describe you? (Select all that apply)

textChoices.text: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

steps.title: In what country were you born?
How would you describe your gender identity? (Select all that apply)
What is the highest level of school you have completed or the highest degree you have received?

textChoices.text: Less than a high school diploma

steps.title: What is your total annual household income?
Do you currently smoke at least 7 cigarettes or e-cigarettes with tobacco per week?
How long did it take you to travel here for today's visit?
Are you currently taking medication for your IBD?
Are you currently taking any antibiotic for a reason related to your IBD?
Antibiotic
Route of administration
steps.text: How do you take your antibiotic?

steps.title: Approximately when did you start taking this medication?
steps.text: Please enter the date in the format MM/DD/YYYY

steps.title: Are you currently taking any probiotic?
Probiotic
IBD Symptoms module
steps.text: Now, we would like to learn a little more about your symptoms and how your IBD is affecting you.

steps.title: Which of the following best describe your IBD over past 6 months?

textChoices.text: Constantly active, giving me symptoms every day
Often active, giving me symptoms most days
Sometimes active, giving me symptoms on same days
Occasionally active, giving me symptoms 1-2 days/month
Rarely active, giving me symptoms on a few days in the past 6 months
I was well in the past 6 months, what I consider a remission or absence of symptoms

steps.title: When you are well, number of bowel movements typically each day
For the remaining questions, please think about the symptoms you have been experiencing over past 7 days:
steps.text: IF YOU PREPARED FOR A COLONOSCOPY DURING THE LAST 7 DAYS, DO NOT CONSIDER THE DAY(S) THAT YOU PREPARED FOR YOUR COLONOSCOPY OR THE DAY OF THE COLONOSCOPY WHEN ANSWERING THESE QUESTIONS

steps.title: Average number of bowel movements per day

textChoices.text: Not applicable, I have an ostomy

steps.title: My stool frequency has been:

textChoices.text: Normal (same as when I am well)
1-2 stools per day more than normal
3-4 stools per day more than normal
5 or more stools per day more than normal
Not applicable, I have an ostomy

steps.title: Average number of liquid/very soft stools per day

textChoices.text: Not applicable, I have an ostomy

steps.title: Rectal Bleeding

textChoices.text: Blood less than 50% of the time
Blood more than 50% of the time

steps.title: Have you had bowel movement(s) when you passed blood alone?
Abdominal pain
Stool urgency

textChoices.text: None. I can wait 15 minutes or longer to have a bowel movement.
Mild. I need to get to the bathroom within 5-15 minutes.
Moderate. I need to get to the bathroom within 2-5 minutes.
Moderately severe. I need to get to the bathroom in less than 2 minutes.
Severe. Sometimes I am unable to make it to the bathroom in time.
Not applicable, I have an ostomy

steps.title: General well-being
In the past seven days, how often did pain restrict your social life to your home?
In the past seven days, how much did pain interfere with your enjoyment of life?
In the past 7 days, how much did pain interfere with your ability to concentrate?
In the past seven days, how much did pain interfere with your ability to work (including work at home)?
In the past seven days, how much did pain interfere with your day to day activities?
In the past seven days, how much did pain interfere with work around the home?
In the past seven days, how much did pain interfere with your ability to participate in social activities?
How much did pain interfere with your household chores?
In the past seven days, I am satisfied with my ability to do things for fun with others.
In the past seven days, I am satisfied with my ability to do things for my family .
In the past seven days, I am satisfied with my ability to meet the needs of my friends.
In the past seven days, I am satisfied with my ability to do the work that is really important to me (include work at home).
In the past seven days, I am frustrated by being too tired to do things I want to do.
In the past seven days, I feel fatigued.
In the past seven days, I have trouble starting things because I am tired.
In the past seven days, how run-down did you feel on average?
In the past seven days, how fatigued were you on average?
In the past seven days, how often were you too tired to enjoy life?
In the past seven days, how often were you too tired to think clearly?
In the past seven days, how often did your fatigue limit you at work (including work at home)?
Congratulations, you have completed the SPARC baseline survey!
steps.text: Please tap on the "Done" on the next screen and hand the electronic device to the coordinator. Thank you again for your participation in SPARC IBD.
